title: Can you explain an idea for an invention you’ve had that you think will help many people? - Quora

response.answer_text: My very favourite of all my inventions is a tool to help create more inventions. And anyone can use it, so anyone can become an inventor with it. I call it the Idea Generator, but it is actually more of a challenge generator, because a full-blown “idea” would require functional detail to be spelled out, which this concept doesn’t do (… yet. Give it a few years and some A.I. plug-ins, and I might have that part ready, too). So what does it do? It tells you your options. As a lecturer in industrial design, I always come upon the same problem with my students at the start of the semester, where everyone is allowed to pick their own project: “Oh gosh, what shall I undertake?” Anything goes. And before you know it, all the guys are doing a skateboard, and all the gals are doing a lamp. It seems to be some sort of law of nature. Hair raising. So I decided to make my students use my generator to help them see how many amazing things they could be doing. It’s very well-liked, and I am happy to share it here. As to how it works: I believe that any solution consists of certain key aspects, which can be predetermined. So we make a list for each key aspect. And then we simply connect at random to see what options we can consider. Some will be hilarious, some will be complete nonsense - but we’ll tickle out the options we have to the extreme, and without impediment of the mind, because we are forcing things together that normally have nothing at all to do with each other. It is therefore a sort of “forced creativity exercise.” It can look like this:
